intro: Rockinghamia, commonly known as the rockinghamia or rockinghamia plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to various regions in Africa, Asia, and Australia, where it thrives in diverse environmental conditions. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, often colorful flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Rockinghamia species typically have alternate leaves and produce capsules as fruits. Due to its ornamental value, some species are cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
